nodes.bodyText: Will this cause unintentional removal of evergreen services like IPCService?
Yes, it would. But I fixed it in the remove step so that it doesn't remove autostart services.
I'm wondering if we want to expose the 'autostart' concept, maybe it's just easier to start all 'autostart' services before kernel start main, in this case we don't need to change 'main' topics .

Not sure I follow you. Are you suggesting that they should not be modeled as dependencies of main? Because this is the reason why we need to do this stuff. I would not want to do that so quickly because we have spent a lot of effort to get the whole dependency ordering and reactions correct.

yes I suggested not model them as dependency of main, since they need to be started before any customer services. eg: IPCService need to start before a customer's service, even it's not defined in dependency. Currently we are already halfway doing that by calling requestStart on all autoStart services first.
I definitely don't want to change that right now for this PR, but we can certainly try/think about that next.

Also for people who doesn't have context, it's confusing to them that we treat auto start service separately in merge config. Currently we have two ways to have a service 'auto start', one is defining as a dependency of main, another is to mark it as 'autostart' . I feel it might be cleaner to rename to 'system components' and start them as part of kernel  initialization
